data.title: Where to watch Luxembourg’s crucial Euro qualifier on the big screen
data.meta_description: Failure to overcome Georgia would make the match on 26 March a friendly encounter
data.text:
Excitement and nerves are running high in Luxembourg as the nation’s football enthusiasts eagerly anticipate Thursday’s pivotal Euro 2024 qualifier match. The national team is gearing up to face Georgia in a semi-final playoff that could chart a historic course for Luxembourg’s footballing legacy.

Should Luxembourg emerge victorious against Georgia, a clash awaits them on 26 March against either Greece or Kazakhstan. Failure to overcome Georgia would relegate Luxembourg to the sidelines, and the match on the 26th would be a friendly encounter.

Also read:

Big game, hot ticket: Luxembourg football match sells out in 20 minutes

Despite the setback of a cancelled charter flight to Georgia for some Luxembourg supporters, numerous events have been organised across various locations in Luxembourg to ensure fans can still revel in the stadium-like atmosphere.

Here’s a overview of the public viewing events available, starting with the capital:

Luxembourg City: An outdoor public viewing will take place at the Knuedler in the capital, with food and drinks provided between 17:00 and 22:00.

Esch-sur-Alzette: Two events are scheduled in Esch. CS Fola will host the game at the Stade Emile Mayrisch clubhouse, with registration details available on the club’s Facebook page. Local rivals Jeunesse will broadcast the game at the clubhouse “Verlängerung”, with registrations accepted via email at reservation.border@gmail.com.

Brouch: Football enthusiasts can head to “an der Koll” in Brouch, where admission for €10 includes two drinks and a portion of popcorn. Further details on registration can be found on the FC Brouch Facebook page.

Bürden: In Bürden, FC 72 Erpeldingen, the home club of Leandro Barreiro, is hosting a public viewing at the “A Maesch” cultural centre. Registration is required by calling +352 621 451 802.

Echternach: The game will be broadcast at the FC Daring bar in Echternach.

Hostert: US Hostert will showcase the match in its clubhouse at the Stade Jos Becker, offering traditional “ham, fries and salad” on the menu for €20. Interested attendees can register via email at fcush@pt.lu.

Junglinster: FC Jeunesse Junglinster will screen the game on two screens in the buvette, and every supporter donning the FLF selection jersey will receive a complimentary drink.

Kehlen: FC Kehlen will broadcast the match at the buvette of the Stade Albert Berchem, offering a free drink for everyone wearing a Luxembourg national team jersey.

Mersch: Supporters can catch the match at the bar of the FC Marisca football pitch in Mersch, where Chilli con Carne will be served.

Niederkerschen: The game will be broadcast at the “Käerjenger Treff” cultural centre, starting at 17:00, with every participant receiving a free beer.

Niederkorn: Supporters can gather at the Stade clubhouse in Niederkorn to watch the game together.

Rosport: FC Victoria’s public viewing will take place at the Rosport football field’s buvette, with food and drinks provided.

Schieren: The game will be shown in the bar at the football facility in Schieren.

Weidingen: FC Wiltz 71 is organising its public viewing at the “am Pëtz” stadium in Weidingen, featuring an LED screen for fans to enjoy the match from the stands.

Wormeldange: Luxembourg supporters can witness the action at the Domaine Viticole Schumacher in Wormeldange.

Outside of these events, bars across the country are set to screen the match. Check with your preferred local if it will be shown.
